nodes.text:
Mandalorian shock trooper was originally used 5,000
years before the Battle of Yavin by Mandalorian Crusaders to describe the Taungs and their gray-colored armor. After the extinction of the Taungs during the Mandalorian wars, Human Mandalorians continued the tradition of the Shock Trooper.

They were fierce warriors who were quick and deadly, and skilled at implementing squad and solo-based fighting strategies. Additionally they likely started the Mandalorian tradition of following the Canons of Honor. They are known to have existed as far back as the  Mandalorian Wars where they were known as Neo-Crusader Shock Troopers. They were frequent adversaries of the Jedi throughout the reign of the Galactic Republic, and were known to occasionally ally themselves with the Sith.

Mandalorian shock troopers were easily recognizable for their distinct Mandalorian-styled armor. What began as a unified army of crusaders eventually devolved to comparatively small bands of mercenaries loosely grouped together based on ideology and family ties. These bands were roughly organized onto two camps, Death Watch and the True Mandalorians, by the time of the Clone Wars.
